reviews.review_msg: Dorothy made me love art history! She is knowledgeable, dynamic, and confident during her lectures, and responds well to questions! She may look intimidating but is very kind. She is very clear with her grading scale. BEWARE- group project! Its time consuming and annoying. Also most of us never read the text book, her lectures were well detailed
Probably one of my fav courses and Profs Ive had. She knows her stuff

someone please teach her to talk slowly. she wants you to take notes while she speaks like a bullet train. We are humans, i should be in the course outline *Do not take this course if you can't write and listen and think at the speed of a bullet* it would be helpful.
Her lectures are very interesting, and important. Her exams are based off what was said in lecture. She talks really fast, so bring a recorder. Don't skip!! Don't be late!!

Very engaging, and made content relatable, put many things in modern perspective. Lectures were 3 hours, but she always gave us a break. Tests were very straightforward, and she let us know exactly what to study which was very helpful. Felt like she was a bit unapproachable, but really was a nice person.

She has been one of the best professors  I have ever had, and one of the best at SFU.  The university should hire more teachers like her. She is inspirational, funny,  relevant, and will never let you down during lectures. She can turn a boring subject into an enjoyable one. I would recommend her any time, any day :)!

I found her to be intriguing and I was constantly engaged even into the late hours of the night (after I had been at school for 12 hours). really informative and easy to listen to, she didn't have many notes on her slides but I found it easy to remember what she discussed from week to week

Dorothy is wonderful; I miss her already. Apart from the tags... Pros: Passionate, clear- like a live TEDtalk every class! Warnings : A group assignment of a local historical object. Tests are tough. Each assignment worth 14. Thick textbook-I never read it but did well. She does fail many ppl!! Pro-tip: bring a tape recorder! never skip!
She is a super awesome and passionate prof! She made me like art history and made me learn a lot about culture. She is also funny and entertaining and the course load was easier than I expected :)

I love Dorothy! She's genuinely interested in the subject matter and is always available for help. Her lectures are super interesting and involved and I have yet to be bored by her. Taking her class is a must!

Dorothy is a wonderful prof, has a real passion for art that translates into her teaching. She's firey and direct, and has great eye for analyzing works. One note- her bark is bigger than her bite, and I mean that in a good way. She seems all bold and "intimidating" at the start of term, but is really just smart, warm and quite sweet.
Exams are extremely tough for anyone who is a poor writer.  Her lectures were generally interesting with a few exceptions which is better than most profs.
Dorothy is one of the best professors i've ever had. She makes 3 hour lectures genuinely interesting.
